title: Sitewide smoother scrolling + light-touch homepage polish

requirements.text: Implement sitewide smooth scrolling for normal page scrolling (mousewheel/trackpad) using a global CSS approach, with strict prefers-reduced-motion compliance so reduced-motion users get default (non-smooth) scrolling.

quotes: Smoother scroll entire site but focused on homepage and light touch polish

acceptanceCriteria: On all pages, normal scrolling animates smoothly without requiring any per-component changes to scroll handlers.
When the OS/browser setting prefers-reduced-motion is enabled, normal scrolling is not smoothed (reverts to default/instant behavior).
No regression to existing animated sections and no new console errors.

requirements.text: Make scroll-to-top and section-jump transitions feel smoother across the entire site by tuning the scroll-to-top easing/duration (frontend/src/hooks/useScrollBehavior.ts) and standardizing section-jump behavior so it is consistent with prefers-reduced-motion support.

quotes: Smoother scroll entire site but focused on homepage and light touch polish

acceptanceCriteria: Internal route navigations (handled in frontend/src/layouts/RootLayout.tsx) use the updated smoother scroll-to-top behavior.
Homepage section jumps (e.g., ForgeHomePage scrollToSection + HomeSectionIndexFooter buttons) remain smooth when reduced-motion is off and are instant/non-animated when reduced-motion is on.
Scroll-to-top animation cancels cleanly if another scroll-to-top is triggered mid-animation (no jitter).

requirements.text: Apply a light-touch homepage polish pass (frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx + existing global Tailwind utilities) focused on micro-motion, spacing, and small visual refinements (glow softness, gradient subtlety, hierarchy tightening) without changing the homepage information architecture or adding new sections/features.

quotes: Smoother scroll entire site but focused on homepage and light touch polish

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section: improved spacing and typographic rhythm (headline/subheadline/CTAs) for faster scanability while keeping the same message and CTAs.

Panels/cards (e.g., 'Agents vs. Traditional AI', capabilities, personas, ecosystem): slightly refined borders/glow/gradient treatments to feel cleaner and less harsh while preserving the Ghost Purple/black theme.
Micro-interactions (hover/focus states) feel consistent and slightly more refined on the homepage (no new motion that violates prefers-reduced-motion behavior already defined in CSS).
No changes to routing, data flow, or backend calls.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn UI sources are immutable).
Do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx (immutable paths).
Keep backend as-is; this request is frontend-only.
nonGoals: No new homepage sections, routes, or product features.
No changes to authentication, canister APIs, or persistence logic.
No introduction of third-party analytics or external services as part of this change.
